page.title: 13INDUSTRY IN OKEHAMPTON
page.content: The 'pie factory' or McVites employs 350 people which makes it the biggest employer in West Devon. McVites make cheese cakes etc., for Marks and Spencer and other food products for Ross frozen foods. Large trucks come in and out all the time to bring raw materials and take products to the shops. This once, small local firm is now part of the United Biscuit empire. Other industries include Spinks food processing, who are building a new factory on the Exeter Road Industrial Estate, Lowfield distribution and Ravensail boat builders making sailing dinghies among others. The local authority employ many people at West Devon Council at its Okehampton offices and depot, and Okehampton College. Out side the town the farming is the most important industry, although there is also some quarrying.
